biotools.summary: Context-aware seeds (CAS) is a seeding framework for finding finding all valid mappings but uses fewer (and longer) seeds, which reduces seed frequencies and increases efficiency of seed-and-extend NGS read mappers. CAS achieves this improvement by attaching a confidence radius to each seed in the reference genome.
